content: 1 Now the Philistines fought against Israel,—and the men of Israel fled′ from before the Philistines, and the wounded fell in Mount Gilboa.

content: 4 Therefore said Saul unto his armour-bearer Draw out thy sword and thrust me through therewith､ lest these uncircumcised come and abuse me, But his armour-bearer would not, for he feared greatly,—so then Saul took the sword, and fell upon it.

content: 5 And when his armour-bearer saw that Saul was dead then he also fell upon the sword､ and died.

content: 6 So Saul died､ and his three sons, and all his house together died.

content: 7 And when all the men of Israel that were in the vale saw��� that they had fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead then forsook they their cities､ and fled, and the Philistines came and dwelt in them.

content: 8 And it came to pass､ on the morrow, when the Philistines came to strip the slain,—that they found Saul､ and his sons, lying prostrate in Mount Gilboa.

content: 12 then rose up all the men of valour, and took away the corpse of Saul､ and the corpses of his sons, and brought them to Jabesh,—and buried their bodies under the terebinth､ in Jabesh, and fasted seven days.

content: 13 Thus died Saul､ for his unfaithfulness wherewith he dealt unfaithfully against Yahweh, over the word of Yahweh､ which he kept not,—and also in asking by necromancy when he desired to enquire;

content: 1 Then did all Israel gather themselves together to David､ unto Hebron, saying,— Lo! thy bone and thy flesh are we.

content: 2 Moreover also in time past even when Saul was king thou wast he that led out and brought in Israel,—and Yahweh thy God said unto thee､ Thou shalt shepherd my people Israel, Yea thou shalt be chief ruler, over my people Israel.

content: 5 And the inhabitants of Jebus said unto David, Thou shalt not come in hither,— But David captured the citadel of Zion, the same is the city of David.

content: 8 And he built the city round about, from Millo even as far as the circuit,—but Joab suffered the remainder of the city to live.

content: 15 And three of the thirty chiefs went down upon the rock､ unto David, into the cave of Adullam,—a host of Philistines being encamped in the vale of Rephaim.

content: 17 And David longed､ and said— Who will give me to drink of the water, out of the well of Bethlehem､ that is within the gate?

content: 18 And the three brake through the host of the Philistines､ and drew water out of the well of Bethlehem､ that was within the gate, and bare it､ and brought it in unto David,—yet would not David drink it, but poured it out unto Yahweh;

content: 19 and said— Far be it from me､ of my God､ that I should do this! The blood of these men shall I drink､ with their lives? For with their lives have they brought it! So he would not drink it. These things did the three heroes.
content_old: 19 and said— Far be it from me､ of my God､ that I should do this! The blood of these men shall I drink､ with their lives? For with their lives have they brought it! So he would not drink it. These things did the three heroes.

content: 20 And Abishai brother of Joab—he was the chief of three, he having brandished his spear against three hundred—who were slain,—and so he had a name among three.

content: 19 And of Manasseh there fell away unto David､ when he came with the Philistines against Saul to battle､ but they helped them not,—for the lords of the Philistines advisedly sent him away､ saying, At the price of our heads he might fall away to his master､ Saul.

content_old: 23 And Berechiah and Elkanah were door-keepers to the ark.

content: 24 And Shebaniah､ and Joshaphat､ and Nethanel､ and Amasai, and Zechariah､ and Benaiah､ and Eliezer､ the priests were blowing with the trumpets､ before the ark of God,—and Obed-edom and Jehiah were door-keepers､ to the ark.
content_old: 24 And Shebaniah､ and Joshaphat､ and Nethanel､ and Amasai, and Zechariah､ and Benaiah､ and Eliezer､ the priests were blowing with the trumpets､ before the ark of God,—and Obed-edom and Jehiah were door-keepers､ to the ark.

content: 25 Thus､ it was David and the elders of Israel､ and the rulers of thousands, who were going､ to bring up the ark of the covenant of Yahweh､ out of the house of Obededom､ with joy.
content_old: 25 Thus､ it was David and the elders of Israel､ and the rulers of thousands, who were going､ to bring up the ark of the covenant of Yahweh､ out of the house of Obededom､ with joy.

content: 26 And so it was that when God helped the Levites, who were bearing the ark of the covenant of Yahweh they sacrificed seven bullocks and seven rams.
content_old: 26 And so it was that when God helped the Levites, who were bearing the ark of the covenant of Yahweh they sacrificed seven bullocks and seven rams.

content: 27 Now David was wrapped about with a robe of byssus､ with all the Levites who were bearing the ark, and the singers, and Chenaniah the leader of the service rendered by the singers,—but upon David was an ephod of white linen.
content_old: 27 Now David was wrapped about with a robe of byssus､ with all the Levites who were bearing the ark, and the singers, and Chenaniah the leader of the service rendered by the singers,—but upon David was an ephod of white linen.

content: 28 So all Israel were bringing up the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, with shouting､ and with sound of the horn, and with trumpets､ and with cymbals,—sounding aloud, with harps､ and lyres.
content_old: 28 So all Israel were bringing up the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, with shouting､ and with sound of the horn, and with trumpets､ and with cymbals,—sounding aloud, with harps､ and lyres.

content: 1 So they brought in the ark of God, and placed it in the midst of the tent､ which David had pitched for it,—and they brought near ascending-sacrifices and peace-offerings､ before God.
content_old: 1 So they brought in the ark of God, and placed it in the midst of the tent､ which David had pitched for it,—and they brought near ascending-sacrifices and peace-offerings､ before God.

content: 2 And when David had made an end of offering the aseending-sacrifices､ and the peace-offerings he blessed the people､ in the name of Yahweh.
content_old: 2 And when David had made an end of offering the aseending-sacrifices､ and the peace-offerings he blessed the people､ in the name of Yahweh.

content: 3 And he apportioned､ to every one of Israel, both man and woman,—to every one､ a loaf of bread, and a sweet drink､ and a raisin cake.
content_old: 3 And he apportioned､ to every one of Israel, both man and woman,—to every one､ a loaf of bread, and a sweet drink､ and a raisin cake.

content: 4 And he placed before the ark of Yahweh certain of the Levites､ as attendants,—and to celebrate､ and to give thanks and render praise, unto Yahweh ､ God of Israel:
content_old: 4 And he placed before the ark of Yahweh certain of the Levites､ as attendants,—and to celebrate､ and to give thanks and render praise, unto Yahweh ､ God of Israel:

content: 5 Asaph the chief､ and､ second to him､ Zechariah,—Jeiel､ and Shemiramoth､ and Jehiel､ and Mattithiah､ and Eliab､ and Benaiah､ and Obed-edom､ and Jeiel, with instruments of harps､ and with lyres, and Asaph with cymbals､ sounding aloud:
content_old: 5 Asaph the chief､ and､ second to him､ Zechariah,—Jeiel､ and Shemiramoth､ and Jehiel､ and Mattithiah､ and Eliab､ and Benaiah､ and Obed-edom､ and Jeiel, with instruments of harps､ and with lyres, and Asaph with cymbals､ sounding aloud:

content: 6 and Benaiah and Jahaziel､ the priests,—with trumpets continually, before the ark of the covenant of God.
content_old: 6 and Benaiah and Jahaziel､ the priests,—with trumpets continually, before the ark of the covenant of God.

content: 7 On that day then David gave these songs in chief, to give thanks unto Yahweh,—through Asaph､ and his brethren:—
content_old: 7 On that day then David gave these songs in chief, to give thanks unto Yahweh,—through Asaph､ and his brethren:—

content: 8 Give ye thanks to Yahweh､ Call upon his name, Make known among the peoples､ his doings;
content_old: 8 Give ye thanks to Yahweh､ Call upon his name, Make known among the peoples､ his doings;

content: 9 Sing ye to him､ Make music unto him, Speak ye of all his wonders.
content_old: 9 Sing ye to him､ Make music unto him, Speak ye of all his wonders.

content: 10 Boast yourselves in his holy name, Joyful be the heart of them who are seeking Yahweh.
content_old: 10 Boast yourselves in his holy name, Joyful be the heart of them who are seeking Yahweh.

content: 11 Search out Yahweh､ and his power, Seek diligently his face､ at all times.
content_old: 11 Search out Yahweh､ and his power, Seek diligently his face､ at all times.

content: 12 Remember his wonders which he hath done, His splendid deeds､ and the just decisions of his mouth.
content_old: 12 Remember his wonders which he hath done, His splendid deeds､ and the just decisions of his mouth.

content: 13 O ye seed of Israel his servant, Sons of Jacob—his chosen ones:
content_old: 13 O ye seed of Israel his servant, Sons of Jacob—his chosen ones:

content: 14 Yahweh himself is our God, Through all the land are his just decisions.
content_old: 14 Yahweh himself is our God, Through all the land are his just decisions.

content: 15 Remember ye to times age-abiding､ his covenant, The word he hath commanded､ to a thousand generations;
content_old: 15 Remember ye to times age-abiding､ his covenant, The word he hath commanded､ to a thousand generations;

content: 16 Which he solemnised with Abraham, And his oath､ to Isaac;
content_old: 16 Which he solemnised with Abraham, And his oath､ to Isaac;

content: 17 And confirmed it､ Unto Jacob､ for a statute, Unto Israel､ as a covenant age-abiding:
content_old: 17 And confirmed it､ Unto Jacob､ for a statute, Unto Israel､ as a covenant age-abiding:

content: 18 Saying､ To thee will I give the land of Canaan､ As your inherited portion:
content_old: 18 Saying､ To thee will I give the land of Canaan､ As your inherited portion:

content: 19 While､ as yet､ ye were men who could be counted, A very few､ and sojourners therein:
content_old: 19 While､ as yet､ ye were men who could be counted, A very few､ and sojourners therein:

content: 20 And they wandered､ from nation to nation, And from one kingdom､ to another people:
content_old: 20 And they wandered､ from nation to nation, And from one kingdom､ to another people:

content: 21 He suffered no man to oppress them, And reproved—for their sakes—kings!
content_old: 21 He suffered no man to oppress them, And reproved—for their sakes—kings!

content: 22 Ye may not touch mine Anointed ones, And to my Prophets may ye do no wrong.
content_old: 22 Ye may not touch mine Anointed ones, And to my Prophets may ye do no wrong.

content: 23 Sing to Yahweh､ all the earth, Tell the tidings､ from day to day､ of his salvation:
content_old: 23 Sing to Yahweh､ all the earth, Tell the tidings､ from day to day､ of his salvation:

content: 24 Recount､ Among the nations, his glory, Among all the peoples､ his wonders.
content_old: 24 Recount､ Among the nations, his glory, Among all the peoples､ his wonders.

content: 25 For great is Yahweh､ and worthy to be mightily praised, And to be revered is he above all gods;
content_old: 25 For great is Yahweh､ and worthy to be mightily praised, And to be revered is he above all gods;

content: 26 For all the gods of the peoples are things of nought, But Yahweh made the heavens.
content_old: 26 For all the gods of the peoples are things of nought, But Yahweh made the heavens.

content: 27 Praise and majesty are before him, Strength and joy are in his dwelling-place.
content_old: 27 Praise and majesty are before him, Strength and joy are in his dwelling-place.

content: 28 Give to Yahweh､ ye families of the peoples, Give to Yahweh､ glory and strength:
content_old: 28 Give to Yahweh､ ye families of the peoples, Give to Yahweh､ glory and strength:

content: 29 Give to Yahweh､ the glory of his name,— Bring ye a present､ and enter before him, Bow down to Yahweh､ in the adornment of holiness:
content_old: 29 Give to Yahweh､ the glory of his name,— Bring ye a present､ and enter before him, Bow down to Yahweh､ in the adornment of holiness:

content: 30 Tremble at his presence､ all the earth, But the world shall be established､ it shall not be shaken.
content_old: 30 Tremble at his presence､ all the earth, But the world shall be established､ it shall not be shaken.

content: 31 Let the heavens rejoice､ and the earth exult, Let them say among the nations､ Yahweh hath become king!
content_old: 31 Let the heavens rejoice､ and the earth exult, Let them say among the nations､ Yahweh hath become king!

content: 32 Let the sea roar､ and the fulness thereof, Let the field leap for joy､ and all that is therein:
content_old: 32 Let the sea roar､ and the fulness thereof, Let the field leap for joy､ and all that is therein:

content: 33 Then shall shout in triumph､ the trees of the forest,— Before Yahweh, for he is coming､ to judge the earth.
content_old: 33 Then shall shout in triumph､ the trees of the forest,— Before Yahweh, for he is coming､ to judge the earth.

content: 34 Give ye thanks unto Yahweh､ For he is good, For age-abiding is his lovingkindness.
content_old: 34 Give ye thanks unto Yahweh､ For he is good, For age-abiding is his lovingkindness.

content: 35 And say ye, Save us､ O God of our salvation, And gather us and deliver us､ from among the nations,— That we may give thanks unto thy holy name, That we may triumph aloud in thy praise.
content_old: 35 And say ye, Save us､ O God of our salvation, And gather us and deliver us､ from among the nations,— That we may give thanks unto thy holy name, That we may triumph aloud in thy praise.

content: 36 Blessed be Yahweh､ God of Israel, From one age even to another age. Then said all the people､ Amen, And gave praise to Yahweh.
content_old: 36 Blessed be Yahweh､ God of Israel, From one age even to another age. Then said all the people､ Amen, And gave praise to Yahweh.

content: 37 So he left there､ before the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, Asaph and his brethren,—to be in attendance before the ark continually､ for the duty of a day on its day;
content_old: 37 So he left there､ before the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, Asaph and his brethren,—to be in attendance before the ark continually､ for the duty of a day on its day;

content: 38 and Obed-edom with his brethren､ sixty-eight,—and Obed-edom son of Jedithun and Hosah to be doorkeepers;
content_old: 38 and Obed-edom with his brethren､ sixty-eight,—and Obed-edom son of Jedithun and Hosah to be doorkeepers;

content: 39 and Zadok the priest､ and his brethren the priests, before the habitation of Yahweh,—in the high place that was in Gibeon:
content_old: 39 and Zadok the priest､ and his brethren the priests, before the habitation of Yahweh,—in the high place that was in Gibeon:

content: 40 to offer ascending-sacrifices unto Yahweh､ upon the altar of ascending-sacrifice,—continually､ morning and evening,—even according to all that is written in the law of Yahweh, which he commanded concerning Israel;
content_old: 40 to offer ascending-sacrifices unto Yahweh､ upon the altar of ascending-sacrifice,—continually､ morning and evening,—even according to all that is written in the law of Yahweh, which he commanded concerning Israel;

content: 41 and with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest of the chosen ones, who were distinguished by name,—to give thanks unto Yahweh, For age-abiding is his lovingkindness!
content_old: 41 and with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest of the chosen ones, who were distinguished by name,—to give thanks unto Yahweh, For age-abiding is his lovingkindness!

content: 42 And with them Heman and Jeduthun､ with the trumpets､ and the cymbals､ for sounding aloud, and the instruments for the songs of God,—and the sons of Jeduthun､ for the gate.
content_old: 42 And with them Heman and Jeduthun､ with the trumpets､ and the cymbals､ for sounding aloud, and the instruments for the songs of God,—and the sons of Jeduthun､ for the gate.

content: 1 And it came to pass when David had taken up his abode in his house that David said unto Nathan the prophet, Lo! I am dwelling in a house of cedars, But the ark of the covenant of Yahweh is under curtains.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass when David had taken up his abode in his house that David said unto Nathan the prophet, Lo! I am dwelling in a house of cedars, But the ark of the covenant of Yahweh is under curtains.

content: 2 Then said Nathan unto David, All that is in thy heart do,—for God is with thee.
content_old: 2 Then said Nathan unto David, All that is in thy heart do,—for God is with thee.

content: 3 But so it was that in that night the word of God came unto Nathan､ saying:
content_old: 3 But so it was that in that night the word of God came unto Nathan､ saying:

content: 4 Go and say unto David my servant, Thus saith Yahweh,— Thou shalt not build me a house､ to dwell in;
content_old: 4 Go and say unto David my servant, Thus saith Yahweh,— Thou shalt not build me a house､ to dwell in;

content: 5 seeing that I have not dwelt in a house, since the day that I brought up Israel, until this day,—but have been from tent to tent､ and without a habitation.
content_old: 5 seeing that I have not dwelt in a house, since the day that I brought up Israel, until this day,—but have been from tent to tent､ and without a habitation.

content: 6 Wheresoever I have wandered with all Israel spake I ever a word with one of the judges of Israel, whom I charged to shepherd my people､ saying,— Wherefore have ye not built me a house of cedars?
content_old: 6 Wheresoever I have wandered with all Israel spake I ever a word with one of the judges of Israel, whom I charged to shepherd my people､ saying,— Wherefore have ye not built me a house of cedars?

content: 7 Now therefore､ thus shalt thou say unto my servant David､ Thus saith Yahweh of hosts, I myself took thee from the pasture､ from after the flock,—to become leader over my people Israel;
content_old: 7 Now therefore､ thus shalt thou say unto my servant David､ Thus saith Yahweh of hosts, I myself took thee from the pasture､ from after the flock,—to become leader over my people Israel;

content: 8 and was with thee whithersoever thou didst go, and have cut off all thine enemies､ from before thee,—and will make thee a name, like the name of the great ones､ who are in the earth;
content_old: 8 and was with thee whithersoever thou didst go, and have cut off all thine enemies､ from before thee,—and will make thee a name, like the name of the great ones､ who are in the earth;

content: 9 and will appoint a place for my people Israel､ and will plant them､ and they shall inhabit their place, and be unsettled no more,—neither shall the sons of perversity again wear them out, as at the first;
content_old: 9 and will appoint a place for my people Israel､ and will plant them､ and they shall inhabit their place, and be unsettled no more,—neither shall the sons of perversity again wear them out, as at the first;

content: 10 even from the days when I put judges in charge over my people Israel, and have subdued all thine enemies,—that I might make thee great, yea a house will Yahweh build for thee.
content_old: 10 even from the days when I put judges in charge over my people Israel, and have subdued all thine enemies,—that I might make thee great, yea a house will Yahweh build for thee.

content: 11 And it shall be that when thy days are fulfilled､ to sleep with thy fathers then will I raise up thy seed after thee, who shall be of thy sons,—and I will establish his kingdom.
content_old: 11 And it shall be that when thy days are fulfilled､ to sleep with thy fathers then will I raise up thy seed after thee, who shall be of thy sons,—and I will establish his kingdom.

content: 12 He shall build me a house,—and I will establish his throne unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 12 He shall build me a house,—and I will establish his throne unto times age-abiding.

content: 13 I will become his father, And he shall become my son,— And my lovingkindness will I not cause to depart from him,—as I caused it to depart from him who was before thee;
content_old: 13 I will become his father, And he shall become my son,— And my lovingkindness will I not cause to depart from him,—as I caused it to depart from him who was before thee;

content: 14 but I will cause him to remain over my house and over my kingdom､ unto times age-abiding,—and his throne shall be established､ unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 14 but I will cause him to remain over my house and over my kingdom､ unto times age-abiding,—and his throne shall be established､ unto times age-abiding.

content: 15 According to all these words､ and according to all this vision so spake Nathan unto David.
content_old: 15 According to all these words､ and according to all this vision so spake Nathan unto David.

content: 16 Then entered King David, and tarried before Yahweh,—and said､ Who am I､ O Yahweh God, and what is my house, that thou hast brought me hitherto;
content_old: 16 Then entered King David, and tarried before Yahweh,—and said､ Who am I､ O Yahweh God, and what is my house, that thou hast brought me hitherto;

content: 17 and hast made this seem little in thine eyes､ O God, in that thou hast spoken concerning the house of thy servant､ for a great while to come? Thus wilt thou provide for me､ according to the rank of manhood､ and hast exalted me､ O Yahweh God!
content_old: 17 and hast made this seem little in thine eyes､ O God, in that thou hast spoken concerning the house of thy servant､ for a great while to come? Thus wilt thou provide for me､ according to the rank of manhood､ and hast exalted me､ O Yahweh God!

content: 18 What yet further can David say unto thee､ thus to honour thy servant,—seeing that thou thyself knowest thine own servant?
content_old: 18 What yet further can David say unto thee､ thus to honour thy servant,—seeing that thou thyself knowest thine own servant?

content: 19 O Yahweh､ for the sake of thy servant, and according to thine own heart hast thou done all this great thing,—making known all the great things.
content_old: 19 O Yahweh､ for the sake of thy servant, and according to thine own heart hast thou done all this great thing,—making known all the great things.

content: 20 O Yahweh､ there is none like unto thee, yea there is no God besides thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
content_old: 20 O Yahweh､ there is none like unto thee, yea there is no God besides thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.

content: 21 Who then is like thy people Israel, a nation alone in the earth,—whom God went to redeem､ to be his own people､ to make for thyself a name for great and fearful things, to drive out nations from before thy people､ whom thou didst redeem out of Egypt;
content_old: 21 Who then is like thy people Israel, a nation alone in the earth,—whom God went to redeem､ to be his own people､ to make for thyself a name for great and fearful things, to drive out nations from before thy people､ whom thou didst redeem out of Egypt;

content: 22 and didst appoint thy people Israel for thyself as a people､ unto times age-abiding,—thou thyself also､ O Yahweh､ becoming their God?
content_old: 22 and didst appoint thy people Israel for thyself as a people､ unto times age-abiding,—thou thyself also､ O Yahweh､ becoming their God?

content: 23 Now therefore､ O Yahweh the word which thou hast spoken concerning thy servant､ and concerning his house be it steadfast unto times age-abiding,—and do as thou hast spoken:
content_old: 23 Now therefore､ O Yahweh the word which thou hast spoken concerning thy servant､ and concerning his house be it steadfast unto times age-abiding,—and do as thou hast spoken:

content: 24 yea let it be steadfast､ and so let thy Name be magnified unto times age-abiding､ saying, Yahweh of hosts､ the God of Israel is a God to Israel! seeing that the house of David thy servant is established before thee.
content_old: 24 yea let it be steadfast､ and so let thy Name be magnified unto times age-abiding､ saying, Yahweh of hosts､ the God of Israel is a God to Israel! seeing that the house of David thy servant is established before thee.

content: 25 For thou､ O my God hast unveiled the ear of thy servant､ that thou wilt build for him a house,—for this cause hath thy servant found it in his heart to pray before thee.
content_old: 25 For thou､ O my God hast unveiled the ear of thy servant､ that thou wilt build for him a house,—for this cause hath thy servant found it in his heart to pray before thee.

content: 26 Now therefore, O Yahweh, thou art God,—therefore hast thou spoken concerning thy servant this goodness.
content_old: 26 Now therefore, O Yahweh, thou art God,—therefore hast thou spoken concerning thy servant this goodness.

content: 1 And it came to pass after this that David smote the Philistines､ and subdued them,—and took Gath and her villages､ out of the hand of the Philistines.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass after this that David smote the Philistines､ and subdued them,—and took Gath and her villages､ out of the hand of the Philistines.

content: 2 And he smote Moab,—and the Moabites became servants to David, bearers of a present.
content_old: 2 And he smote Moab,—and the Moabites became servants to David, bearers of a present.

content: 3 And David smote Hadarezer king of Zobah､ towards Hamath,—as he went to establish his hold of the river Euphrates.
content_old: 3 And David smote Hadarezer king of Zobah､ towards Hamath,—as he went to establish his hold of the river Euphrates.

content: 4 And David captured from him a thousand chariots､ and seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen,—and David destroyed all the chariots, saving that he reserved from them a hundred chariots.
content_old: 4 And David captured from him a thousand chariots､ and seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen,—and David destroyed all the chariots, saving that he reserved from them a hundred chariots.

content: 5 And when the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadarezer king of Zobah David smote of the Syrians, twenty-two thousand men.
content_old: 5 And when the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadarezer king of Zobah David smote of the Syrians, twenty-two thousand men.

content: 6 And David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus, and so it was that the Syrians became David’s servants､ bearers of a present,—so Yahweh gave victory to David, whithersoever he went.
content_old: 6 And David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus, and so it was that the Syrians became David’s servants､ bearers of a present,—so Yahweh gave victory to David, whithersoever he went.

content: 7 And David took the shields of gold, that were upon the servants of Hadarezer,—and brought them to Jerusalem;
content_old: 7 And David took the shields of gold, that were upon the servants of Hadarezer,—and brought them to Jerusalem;

content: 8 also from Tibhath and from Cûn､ cities of Hadarezer David took very much bronze,—therewith did Solomon make the sea of bronze､ and the pillars, and the vessels of bronze.
content_old: 8 also from Tibhath and from Cûn､ cities of Hadarezer David took very much bronze,—therewith did Solomon make the sea of bronze､ and the pillars, and the vessels of bronze.

content: 9 And when Tou､ king of Hamath､ heard that David had smitten all the force of Hadarezer king of Zobah
content_old: 9 And when Tou､ king of Hamath､ heard that David had smitten all the force of Hadarezer king of Zobah

content: 10 he sent Hadoram his son unto King David､ to ask after his welfare､ and to bless him､ because he had made war against Hadarezer and had smitten him, for a man making wars against Tou had been Hadarezer,—and he had with him all manner of vessels of gold and silver and bronze;
content_old: 10 he sent Hadoram his son unto King David､ to ask after his welfare､ and to bless him､ because he had made war against Hadarezer and had smitten him, for a man making wars against Tou had been Hadarezer,—and he had with him all manner of vessels of gold and silver and bronze;

content: 11 them also did King David hallow unto Yahweh, with the silver and the gold､ that he bare away from all the nations,—from Edom､ and from Moab､ and from the sons of Ammon, and from the Philistines､ and from Amalek.
content_old: 11 them also did King David hallow unto Yahweh, with the silver and the gold､ that he bare away from all the nations,—from Edom､ and from Moab､ and from the sons of Ammon, and from the Philistines､ and from Amalek.

content: 12 Moreover Abishai､ son of Zeruiah smote Edom､ in the Valley of Salt,—eighteen thousand;
content_old: 12 Moreover Abishai､ son of Zeruiah smote Edom､ in the Valley of Salt,—eighteen thousand;

content: 13 and set in Edom garrisons, and all Edom became servants unto David,—and Yahweh gave David the victory, whithersoever he went.
content_old: 13 and set in Edom garrisons, and all Edom became servants unto David,—and Yahweh gave David the victory, whithersoever he went.

content: 14 So David reigned over all Israel,—and he was executing justice and righteousness for all his people;
content_old: 14 So David reigned over all Israel,—and he was executing justice and righteousness for all his people;

content: 15 and Joab､ son of Zeruiah was over the army,—and Jehoshaphat､ son of Elihud was recorder;
content_old: 15 and Joab､ son of Zeruiah was over the army,—and Jehoshaphat､ son of Elihud was recorder;

content: 16 and Zadok､ son of Ahitub､ and Abimelech son of Abiathar were priests,—and Shavsha was scribe;
content_old: 16 and Zadok､ son of Ahitub､ and Abimelech son of Abiathar were priests,—and Shavsha was scribe;

content: 1 And it came to pass after this that Nahash king of the sons of Ammon died,—and Hanun his son reigned in his stead.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass after this that Nahash king of the sons of Ammon died,—and Hanun his son reigned in his stead.

content: 2 Then said David— I will shew lovingkindness unto Hanun､ son of Nahash,—for his father shewed unto me lovingkindness. So David sent messengers to console him concerning his father,—and the servants of David came into the land of the sons of Ammon unto Hanun､ to console him.
content_old: 2 Then said David— I will shew lovingkindness unto Hanun､ son of Nahash,—for his father shewed unto me lovingkindness. So David sent messengers to console him concerning his father,—and the servants of David came into the land of the sons of Ammon unto Hanun､ to console him.

content: 3 Then said the rulers of the sons of Ammon unto Hanun, Doth David honour thy father in thine eyes, that he hath sent to thee comforters? Is it not for the sake of exploring and overthrowing､ and spying out the land that his servants have come to thee?
content_old: 3 Then said the rulers of the sons of Ammon unto Hanun, Doth David honour thy father in thine eyes, that he hath sent to thee comforters? Is it not for the sake of exploring and overthrowing､ and spying out the land that his servants have come to thee?

content: 4 So Hanun took the servants of David､ and shaved them, and cut off their upper garments in the middle､ as far as their parts of shame,—and let them go.
content_old: 4 So Hanun took the servants of David､ and shaved them, and cut off their upper garments in the middle､ as far as their parts of shame,—and let them go.

content: 5 And people went and told David､ concerning the men, so he sent to meet them､ because the men were greatly ashamed,—and the king said— Tarry at Jericho, until your beards be grown､ and then return.
content_old: 5 And people went and told David､ concerning the men, so he sent to meet them､ because the men were greatly ashamed,—and the king said— Tarry at Jericho, until your beards be grown､ and then return.

content: 6 And when the sons of Ammon saw, that they had made themselves odious with David Hanun and the sons of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver､ to hire for themselves—out of Mesopotamia､ and out of Aram-maacah､ and out of Zobah—chariots､ and horsemen.
content_old: 6 And when the sons of Ammon saw, that they had made themselves odious with David Hanun and the sons of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver､ to hire for themselves—out of Mesopotamia､ and out of Aram-maacah､ and out of Zobah—chariots､ and horsemen.

content: 7 So they hired for themselves thirty-two thousand chariots､ and the king of Maacah､ and his people, who came and pitched before Medeba,—and the sons of Ammon gathered themselves together out of their cities, and entered into the war.
content_old: 7 So they hired for themselves thirty-two thousand chariots､ and the king of Maacah､ and his people, who came and pitched before Medeba,—and the sons of Ammon gathered themselves together out of their cities, and entered into the war.

content: 8 Now when David heard he sent Joab and all the army of heroes.
content_old: 8 Now when David heard he sent Joab and all the army of heroes.

content: 9 And the sons of Ammon came out, and set in array for the battle､ at the opening of the city,—whereas the kings who had come were by themselves､ in the field.
content_old: 9 And the sons of Ammon came out, and set in array for the battle､ at the opening of the city,—whereas the kings who had come were by themselves､ in the field.

content: 10 So when Joab saw that the battle confronted him､ before and behind,—he chose out of all the choice in Israel, and set in array to meet the Syrians;
content_old: 10 So when Joab saw that the battle confronted him､ before and behind,—he chose out of all the choice in Israel, and set in array to meet the Syrians;

content: 11 and the rest of the people delivered he into the hand of Abishai his brother,—and they set in array, to meet the sons of Ammon.
content_old: 11 and the rest of the people delivered he into the hand of Abishai his brother,—and they set in array, to meet the sons of Ammon.

content: 12 And he said— If too strong for me be the Syrians then shalt thou come to my help,—but if the sons of Ammon be too strong for thee then will I help thee.
content_old: 12 And he said— If too strong for me be the Syrians then shalt thou come to my help,—but if the sons of Ammon be too strong for thee then will I help thee.

content: 13 Be strong､ and let us put forth our strength､ for the sake of our people, and for the sake of the cities of our God,—and let Yahweh do what is good in his own eyes.
content_old: 13 Be strong､ and let us put forth our strength､ for the sake of our people, and for the sake of the cities of our God,—and let Yahweh do what is good in his own eyes.

content: 14 Then did Joab､ and all the people who were with him､ draw near before the Syrians unto the battle,—and they fled from before him.
content_old: 14 Then did Joab､ and all the people who were with him､ draw near before the Syrians unto the battle,—and they fled from before him.

content: 15 And when the sons of Ammon saw that the Syrians had fled then fled they also from before Abishai his brother, and entered the city,—and Joab came to Jerusalem.
content_old: 15 And when the sons of Ammon saw that the Syrians had fled then fled they also from before Abishai his brother, and entered the city,—and Joab came to Jerusalem.

content: 16 And when the Syrians saw that they had been defeated before Israel､ then sent they messengers､ and brought out the Syrians who were Beyond the River,—with Shophach captain of the army of Hadarezer､ before them.
content_old: 16 And when the Syrians saw that they had been defeated before Israel､ then sent they messengers､ and brought out the Syrians who were Beyond the River,—with Shophach captain of the army of Hadarezer､ before them.

content: 17 And it was told David､ and he gathered together all Israel､ and crossed the Jordan, and came unto them, and set in array against them,—and when David had set in array against the Syrians for battle they fought with him.
content_old: 17 And it was told David､ and he gathered together all Israel､ and crossed the Jordan, and came unto them, and set in array against them,—and when David had set in array against the Syrians for battle they fought with him.

content: 18 And the Syrians fled from before Israel, and David slew of the Syrians the men of seven thousand chariots, and forty thousand footmen,—and Shophach captain of the army he put to death.
content_old: 18 And the Syrians fled from before Israel, and David slew of the Syrians the men of seven thousand chariots, and forty thousand footmen,—and Shophach captain of the army he put to death.

content: 1 And it came to pass at the time of the turn of the year､ at the time of the going forth of kings that Joab led forth the force of the army､ and laid waste the land of the sons of Ammon､ and came and besieged Rabbah, but David was tarrying in Jerusalem,—and Joab smote Rabbah, and overthrew it.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass at the time of the turn of the year､ at the time of the going forth of kings that Joab led forth the force of the army､ and laid waste the land of the sons of Ammon､ and came and besieged Rabbah, but David was tarrying in Jerusalem,—and Joab smote Rabbah, and overthrew it.

content: 2 And David took the crown of their king from off his head､ and found it weighed a talent of gold, and therein were precious stones, and it was set on the head of David,—and the spoil of the city brought he forth､ in great abundance;
content_old: 2 And David took the crown of their king from off his head､ and found it weighed a talent of gold, and therein were precious stones, and it was set on the head of David,—and the spoil of the city brought he forth､ in great abundance;

content: 3 and the people that were therein brought he forth､ and cut with the saw and with threshing sledges of iron and with axes, thus also used David to do unto all the cities of the sons of Ammon,—and David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.
content_old: 3 and the people that were therein brought he forth､ and cut with the saw and with threshing sledges of iron and with axes, thus also used David to do unto all the cities of the sons of Ammon,—and David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.

content: 4 And it came to pass after this that there was yet again a battle in Gezer､ with the Philistines,—then Sibbecai the Hushatbite smote Sippai of the children of the giants､ and they were subdued.
content_old: 4 And it came to pass after this that there was yet again a battle in Gezer､ with the Philistines,—then Sibbecai the Hushatbite smote Sippai of the children of the giants､ and they were subdued.

content: 5 And there again came to be a battle with the Philistines,—and Elhanan son of Jair smote Lahmi､ brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
content_old: 5 And there again came to be a battle with the Philistines,—and Elhanan son of Jair smote Lahmi､ brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.

content: 6 And there again came to be war with Gath,—where was a man of great stature､ whose fingers and toes six on each hand and foot were four and twenty, and he aIso had been born unto the giant.
content_old: 6 And there again came to be war with Gath,—where was a man of great stature､ whose fingers and toes six on each hand and foot were four and twenty, and he aIso had been born unto the giant.

content: 7 But when he reproached Israel Jonathan､ son of Shimea brother of David､ smote him.
content_old: 7 But when he reproached Israel Jonathan､ son of Shimea brother of David､ smote him.

content: 1 Then the accuser stood up､ against Israel,—and moved David､ to number Israel.
content_old: 1 Then the accuser stood up､ against Israel,—and moved David､ to number Israel.

content: 2 And David said unto Joab and unto the rulers of the people, Go､ number Israel, from Beer-sheba even unto Dan,—and bring the report unto me, that I may know the number of them.
content_old: 2 And David said unto Joab and unto the rulers of the people, Go､ number Israel, from Beer-sheba even unto Dan,—and bring the report unto me, that I may know the number of them.

content: 3 Then said Joab､ May Yahweh add unto his people､ as many as they are､ a hundred times, but are they not､ my lord O king､ all of them my lord’s､ as servants? wherefore should my lord seek this? wherefore should it become guilt to Israel?
content_old: 3 Then said Joab､ May Yahweh add unto his people､ as many as they are､ a hundred times, but are they not､ my lord O king､ all of them my lord’s､ as servants? wherefore should my lord seek this? wherefore should it become guilt to Israel?

content: 4 But the word of the king prevailed against Joab,—and Joab departed､ and went to and fro throughout all Israel, and came to Jerusalem.
content_old: 4 But the word of the king prevailed against Joab,—and Joab departed､ and went to and fro throughout all Israel, and came to Jerusalem.

content: 5 And Joab delivered the sum of the number of the people､ unto David,—and all Israel was found to be a thousand thousand and a hundred thousand men､ who drew sword, and Judah､ four hundred and seventy thousand men､ who drew sword.
content_old: 5 And Joab delivered the sum of the number of the people､ unto David,—and all Israel was found to be a thousand thousand and a hundred thousand men､ who drew sword, and Judah､ four hundred and seventy thousand men､ who drew sword.

content: 6 But Levi and Benjamin counted he not among them,—for detestable was the word of the king unto Joab.
content_old: 6 But Levi and Benjamin counted he not among them,—for detestable was the word of the king unto Joab.

content: 7 And it was displeasing in the eyes of God, concerning this thing,—therefore smote he Israel.
content_old: 7 And it was displeasing in the eyes of God, concerning this thing,—therefore smote he Israel.

content: 8 And David said unto God, I have sinned greatly､ in that I have done this thing,—but now I beseech thee､ take away the iniquity of thy servant, for I have shown myself very foolish.
content_old: 8 And David said unto God, I have sinned greatly､ in that I have done this thing,—but now I beseech thee､ take away the iniquity of thy servant, for I have shown myself very foolish.

content: 9 Then spake Yahweh unto Gad, the seer of David､ saying:
content_old: 9 Then spake Yahweh unto Gad, the seer of David､ saying:

content: 10 Go—and thou shalt speak unto David､ saying､ Thus saith Yahweh, Three things do I offer thee,—choose thee one from among them､ that I may do it unto thee.
content_old: 10 Go—and thou shalt speak unto David､ saying､ Thus saith Yahweh, Three things do I offer thee,—choose thee one from among them､ that I may do it unto thee.

content: 11 So Gad came unto David,—and said to him､ Thus saith Yahweh､
content_old: 11 So Gad came unto David,—and said to him､ Thus saith Yahweh､

content: 12 Choose thee:— Whether for three years there be famine, Or for three months that thou flee before thine adversaries､ while the sword of thine enemies overtaketh thee. Or for three days the sword of Yahweh､ and pestilence be in the land, with the messenger of Yahweh laying waste throughout all the boundary of Israel,— Now therefore､ see, what answer I shall return unto him that sent me.
content_old: 12 Choose thee:— Whether for three years there be famine, Or for three months that thou flee before thine adversaries､ while the sword of thine enemies overtaketh thee. Or for three days the sword of Yahweh､ and pestilence be in the land, with the messenger of Yahweh laying waste throughout all the boundary of Israel,— Now therefore､ see, what answer I shall return unto him that sent me.

content: 13 And David said unto Gad､ I am in a great strait,— Oh let me fall､ I pray thee､ into the hand of Yahweh､ for abounding are his compassions､ exceedingly, but into the hand of man let me not fall.
content_old: 13 And David said unto Gad､ I am in a great strait,— Oh let me fall､ I pray thee､ into the hand of Yahweh､ for abounding are his compassions､ exceedingly, but into the hand of man let me not fall.

content: 14 So Yahweh laid pestilence､ upon Israel,—and there fell､ of Israel, seventy thousand men.
content_old: 14 So Yahweh laid pestilence､ upon Israel,—and there fell､ of Israel, seventy thousand men.

content: 15 And God sent a messenger to Jerusalem､ to lay it waste, but as he was laying it waste Yahweh looked､ and relented concerning the calamity, and said unto the messenger who was laying wast､ Enough! now stay thy hand. And the messenger of Yahweh was standing by the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
content_old: 15 And God sent a messenger to Jerusalem､ to lay it waste, but as he was laying it waste Yahweh looked､ and relented concerning the calamity, and said unto the messenger who was laying wast､ Enough! now stay thy hand. And the messenger of Yahweh was standing by the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

content: 16 And when David lifted up his eyes､ and saw the messenger of Yahweh ､ standing, between the earth and the heavens, and his sword drawn､ in his hand, stretched out over Jerusalem then fell David and the elders､ clothed in sackcloth､ upon their faces.
content_old: 16 And when David lifted up his eyes､ and saw the messenger of Yahweh ､ standing, between the earth and the heavens, and his sword drawn､ in his hand, stretched out over Jerusalem then fell David and the elders､ clothed in sackcloth､ upon their faces.

content: 17 And David said unto God､ Was it not I who gave word to number the people? Yea I it was who sinned and did the great wrong, what then had these sheep done? O Yahweh､ my God, let thy hand､ I beseech thee､ be against me､ and against the house of my father, but not against thy people that they should be plagued!
content_old: 17 And David said unto God､ Was it not I who gave word to number the people? Yea I it was who sinned and did the great wrong, what then had these sheep done? O Yahweh､ my God, let thy hand､ I beseech thee､ be against me､ and against the house of my father, but not against thy people that they should be plagued!

content: 18 And the messenger of Yahweh commanded Gad､ to say unto David,—that David should go up､ to rear an altar unto Yahweh, in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
content_old: 18 And the messenger of Yahweh commanded Gad､ to say unto David,—that David should go up､ to rear an altar unto Yahweh, in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

content: 19 So David went up､ according to the word of Gad, which he spake in the name of Yahweh.
content_old: 19 So David went up､ according to the word of Gad, which he spake in the name of Yahweh.

content: 20 And Ornan turned､ and saw the messenger, but his four sons with him were hiding themselves,—now Ornan had been threshing wheat.
content_old: 20 And Ornan turned､ and saw the messenger, but his four sons with him were hiding themselves,—now Ornan had been threshing wheat.

content: 21 Then came David unto Ornan,—and Ornan looked､ and saw David, and went forth out of the threshing-floor, and bowed himself unto David､ with his face to the ground.
content_old: 21 Then came David unto Ornan,—and Ornan looked､ and saw David, and went forth out of the threshing-floor, and bowed himself unto David､ with his face to the ground.

content: 22 And David said unto Ornan Grant me the place of the threshing-floor, that I may build thereon an altar､ unto Yahweh,—for silver in full shalt thou grant it me, that the plague may be stayed from off the people.
content_old: 22 And David said unto Ornan Grant me the place of the threshing-floor, that I may build thereon an altar､ unto Yahweh,—for silver in full shalt thou grant it me, that the plague may be stayed from off the people.

content: 23 And Ornan said unto David､ Take it to thee, and let my lord the king do what is good in his own eyes,—see! I have given the oxen for ascending-sacrifices､ and the threshing implements for wood､ and the wheat for a meal-offering､—the whole have I given.
content_old: 23 And Ornan said unto David､ Take it to thee, and let my lord the king do what is good in his own eyes,—see! I have given the oxen for ascending-sacrifices､ and the threshing implements for wood､ and the wheat for a meal-offering､—the whole have I given.

content: 24 Then said King David to Ornan､ Nay! but I will surely buy it for silver in full,—for I will not take that which is thine for Yahweh, nor offer an ascending-sacrifice that hath cost me nothing.
content_old: 24 Then said King David to Ornan､ Nay! but I will surely buy it for silver in full,—for I will not take that which is thine for Yahweh, nor offer an ascending-sacrifice that hath cost me nothing.

content: 25 So David gave to Ornan､ for the place,—shekels of gold, by weight､ six hundred.
content_old: 25 So David gave to Ornan､ for the place,—shekels of gold, by weight､ six hundred.

content: 26 And David built there an altar unto Yahweh, and caused to go up ascending-sacrifices､ and peace-offerings,—and called unto Yahweh, and he responded to him､ by fire､ out of the heavens, upon the altar of ascending-sacrifice.
content_old: 26 And David built there an altar unto Yahweh, and caused to go up ascending-sacrifices､ and peace-offerings,—and called unto Yahweh, and he responded to him､ by fire､ out of the heavens, upon the altar of ascending-sacrifice.

content: 27 And Yahweh gave word to the messenger､ and he put back his sword into its sheath.
content_old: 27 And Yahweh gave word to the messenger､ and he put back his sword into its sheath.

content: 28 At that time, when David saw that Yahweh had answered him in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite then he sacrificed there.
content_old: 28 At that time, when David saw that Yahweh had answered him in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite then he sacrificed there.

content: 29 But the habitation of Yahweh､ which Moses made in the desert､ and the altar of ascending-sacrifice were at that time in the high place at Gibeon;
content_old: 29 But the habitation of Yahweh､ which Moses made in the desert､ and the altar of ascending-sacrifice were at that time in the high place at Gibeon;

content: 1 Then said David, This is the house of Yahweh God,—and this is the altar of ascending-sacrifice､ for Israel.
content_old: 1 Then said David, This is the house of Yahweh God,—and this is the altar of ascending-sacrifice､ for Israel.

content: 2 And David gave word, to gather together the sojourners､ who were in the land of Israel,—and he set hewers to hew squared stones, for building the house of God;
content_old: 2 And David gave word, to gather together the sojourners､ who were in the land of Israel,—and he set hewers to hew squared stones, for building the house of God;

content: 3 and iron in abundance､ for nails for the doors of the gates､ and for hooks did David prepare,—and bronze in abundance､ without weight;
content_old: 3 and iron in abundance､ for nails for the doors of the gates､ and for hooks did David prepare,—and bronze in abundance､ without weight;

content: 4 and cedar-trees､ even without number,—for the Zidonians and the Tyreans brought cedar-trees in abundance､ unto David.
content_old: 4 and cedar-trees､ even without number,—for the Zidonians and the Tyreans brought cedar-trees in abundance､ unto David.

content: 5 And David said､ Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house to be built must be great and lofty and famous and beautiful､ for all lands,—oh let me then prepare for it. So David prepared abundantly､ before his death.
content_old: 5 And David said､ Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house to be built must be great and lofty and famous and beautiful､ for all lands,—oh let me then prepare for it. So David prepared abundantly､ before his death.

content: 6 Then he called for Solomon his son,—and charged him､ to build a house, for Yahweh､ God of Israel.
content_old: 6 Then he called for Solomon his son,—and charged him､ to build a house, for Yahweh､ God of Israel.

content: 7 And David said to Solomon his son,— As for me it was near my heart to build a house for the Name of Yahweh my God;
content_old: 7 And David said to Solomon his son,— As for me it was near my heart to build a house for the Name of Yahweh my God;

content: 8 but the word of Yahweh came unto me､ saying, Blood in abundance hast thou shed, And great wars hast thou made,— Thou shalt not build a house for my Name, Because much blood hast thou shed upon the earth､ before me.
content_old: 8 but the word of Yahweh came unto me､ saying, Blood in abundance hast thou shed, And great wars hast thou made,— Thou shalt not build a house for my Name, Because much blood hast thou shed upon the earth､ before me.

content: 9 Lo! a son born to thee､ He shall be a man of rest, And I will give him rest from all his enemies､ round about,— For Solomon shall be his Name, And peace and quietness will I bestow upon Israel､ in his days;
content_old: 9 Lo! a son born to thee､ He shall be a man of rest, And I will give him rest from all his enemies､ round about,— For Solomon shall be his Name, And peace and quietness will I bestow upon Israel､ in his days;

content: 10 He shall build a house for my Name, And he shall be my son､ And I will be his father,— Therefore will I establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel､ unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 10 He shall build a house for my Name, And he shall be my son､ And I will be his father,— Therefore will I establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel､ unto times age-abiding.

content: 11 Now my son, Yahweh be with thee,—so shalt thou be prosperous､ and shalt build the house of Yahweh thy God, according as he hath spoken concerning thee.
content_old: 11 Now my son, Yahweh be with thee,—so shalt thou be prosperous､ and shalt build the house of Yahweh thy God, according as he hath spoken concerning thee.

content: 12 Only Yahweh give thee discretion and understanding, and give thee charge over Israel,—so that thou take heed unto the law of Yahweh thy God.
content_old: 12 Only Yahweh give thee discretion and understanding, and give thee charge over Israel,—so that thou take heed unto the law of Yahweh thy God.

content: 13 IIThen shalt thou prosper, if thou take heed to do the statutes and the regulations, which Yahweh commanded Moses､ concerning Israel,—be strong and bold, thou mayst not be in fear､ nor be dismayed.
content_old: 13 IIThen shalt thou prosper, if thou take heed to do the statutes and the regulations, which Yahweh commanded Moses､ concerning Israel,—be strong and bold, thou mayst not be in fear､ nor be dismayed.

content: 14 Lo! then in my humiliation have I prepared for the house of Yahweh､ of gold a hundred thousand talents､ and of silver a thousand thousand talents, and as for bronze and iron without weight, for an abundance hath it become,—timber also and stone have I prepared､ and thereunto thou canst add.
content_old: 14 Lo! then in my humiliation have I prepared for the house of Yahweh､ of gold a hundred thousand talents､ and of silver a thousand thousand talents, and as for bronze and iron without weight, for an abundance hath it become,—timber also and stone have I prepared､ and thereunto thou canst add.

content: 15 And with thee､ in abundance are workmen, hewers and carvers of stone and wood,—and every sort of wise man､ in all manner of work:
content_old: 15 And with thee､ in abundance are workmen, hewers and carvers of stone and wood,—and every sort of wise man､ in all manner of work:

content: 16 for gold and for silver and for bronze and for iron､ without number. Arise and do, And Yahweh be with thee!
content_old: 16 for gold and for silver and for bronze and for iron､ without number. Arise and do, And Yahweh be with thee!

content: 17 And David charged all the rulers of Israel, to help Solomon his son:—
content_old: 17 And David charged all the rulers of Israel, to help Solomon his son:—

content: 18 Is not Yahweh your God with you? and hath he not given you rest on every side? for he hath given into my hand､ the inhabitants of the land, and subdued is the land before Yahweh､ and before his people.
content_old: 18 Is not Yahweh your God with you? and hath he not given you rest on every side? for he hath given into my hand､ the inhabitants of the land, and subdued is the land before Yahweh､ and before his people.

content: 1 Now David was old､ and satisfied with days,—so he made Solomon his son king､ over Israel;
content_old: 1 Now David was old､ and satisfied with days,—so he made Solomon his son king､ over Israel;

content: 2 and gathered together all the rulers of Israel, with the priests､ and the Levites.
content_old: 2 and gathered together all the rulers of Israel, with the priests､ and the Levites.

content: 3 Now the Levites were numbered, from thirty years old and upwards,—and their number by their polls､ of mature men, was thirty-eight thousand.
content_old: 3 Now the Levites were numbered, from thirty years old and upwards,—and their number by their polls､ of mature men, was thirty-eight thousand.

content: 4 Of these—to preside over the work of the house of Yahweh were twenty-four thousand,—and officers and judges､ six thousand;
content_old: 4 Of these—to preside over the work of the house of Yahweh were twenty-four thousand,—and officers and judges､ six thousand;

content: 5 and four thousand were doorkeepers,—and four thousand were offerers of praise unto Yahweh, with instruments､ Which said David I made for offering praise.
content_old: 5 and four thousand were doorkeepers,—and four thousand were offerers of praise unto Yahweh, with instruments､ Which said David I made for offering praise.

content: 6 And David divided them into courses,—pertaining to the sons of Levi, to Gershon､ Kohath and Merari.
content_old: 6 And David divided them into courses,—pertaining to the sons of Levi, to Gershon､ Kohath and Merari.

content: 7 Of the Gershonites Ladan and Shimei.
content_old: 7 Of the Gershonites Ladan and Shimei.

content: 8 The sons of Ladan the chief Jehiel､ and Zetham and Joel､ three
content_old: 8 The sons of Ladan the chief Jehiel､ and Zetham and Joel､ three

content: 9 The sons of Shimei Shelomoth and Haziel and Haran､ three,—these were the ancestral chiefs of Ladan.
content_old: 9 The sons of Shimei Shelomoth and Haziel and Haran､ three,—these were the ancestral chiefs of Ladan.

content: 10 And the sons of Shimei Jahath､ Zina, and Jeush､ and Beriah,—these were the sons of Shimei､ four.
content_old: 10 And the sons of Shimei Jahath､ Zina, and Jeush､ and Beriah,—these were the sons of Shimei､ four.

content: 11 And Jahath was chief, and Zizah the second,—but Jeush and Beriah had not many sons, so they became an ancestral house､ by one reckoning.
content_old: 11 And Jahath was chief, and Zizah the second,—but Jeush and Beriah had not many sons, so they became an ancestral house､ by one reckoning.

content: 12 The sons of Kohath Amram､ Izhar､ Hebron､ and Uzziel, four.
content_old: 12 The sons of Kohath Amram､ Izhar､ Hebron､ and Uzziel, four.

content: 13 The sons of Amram Aaron and Moses,—and Aaron was separated､ to hallow the holy of holies､ he and his sons､ unto times age-abiding, to make a perfume before Yahweh､ to be in attendance upon him､ and to bless in his name､ unto times age-abiding;
content_old: 13 The sons of Amram Aaron and Moses,—and Aaron was separated､ to hallow the holy of holies､ he and his sons､ unto times age-abiding, to make a perfume before Yahweh､ to be in attendance upon him､ and to bless in his name､ unto times age-abiding;

content: 14 and as for Moses､ the man of God his sons were called unto the tribe of Levi.
content_old: 14 and as for Moses､ the man of God his sons were called unto the tribe of Levi.

content: 15 The sons of Moses were Gershom､ and Eliezer.
content_old: 15 The sons of Moses were Gershom､ and Eliezer.

content: 16 The sons of Gershom were Shebuel the chief;
content_old: 16 The sons of Gershom were Shebuel the chief;

content: 17 and the sons of Eliezer were Rehabiah the chief,—and Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
content_old: 17 and the sons of Eliezer were Rehabiah the chief,—and Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.

content: 18 The sons of Izhar Shelomith the chief.
content_old: 18 The sons of Izhar Shelomith the chief.

content: 19 The sons of Hebron Jeriah the chief､ Amariah the second, Jehaziel the third､ and Jekameam the fourth.

content_old: 16 Furthermore over the tribes of Israel the chief ruler of the Reubenites was Eliezer､ son of Zichri. Of the Simeonites Shephatiah､ son of Maacah.

content: 17 Of Levi Hashabiah､ son of Kemuel. Of Aaron Zadok.
content_old: 17 Of Levi Hashabiah､ son of Kemuel. Of Aaron Zadok.

content_old: 18 Of Judah Elihu､ one of the brethren of David. Of Issachar Omri､ son of Michael.

content_old: 19 Of Zebulun Ishmaiah､ son of Obadiah. Of Naphtali Jeremoth､ son of Azriel.
